english: oyster; oyster meat; edible bivalve; dried oyster

etymology.interpretation: 虫 marks it as a creature in the invertebrate realm, which in Chinese script extends to shellfish and similar animals. 豪 provides the sound háo; the simplified form uses 号 as a streamlined phonetic while preserving a similar pronunciation.
etymology.simplification: Right-side phonetic simplified from 豪/號 to 号 to reduce strokes while keeping the háo sound; this aligns with earlier variant usage (e.g., 𧐢) and 20th‑century standardization.

examples.chinese: 我爱吃生蚝(我愛吃生蠔)。
炒菜放点蚝油更鲜(炒菜放點蠔油更鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Chǎocài fàng diǎn háoyóu gèng xiān.
examples.english: Adding a bit of oyster sauce makes stir-fries tastier.

examples.chinese: 过年会买些蚝干煲汤(過年會買些蠔乾煲湯)。
examples.pinyin: Guònián huì mǎi xiē háogān bāo tāng.
examples.english: We buy some dried oysters to make soup for the New Year.
